intro: Myosurus cauda-muris, commonly known as the mouse-tail, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Myosurus cauda-muris is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in damp conditions.
